intro: Scandix aromatica, commonly known as the aromatic scurvygrass, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Scandix aromatica is known for its subtle aromatic scent and its ability to thrive in low-nutrient conditions. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in alpine ecosystems and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
